data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Oxygen (A/F) Sensor Pumping Current Circuit / Open (Bank 1 Sensor 1)

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: An open in the circuit between terminals A1A+ and A1A- of the A/F sensor while the engine is running (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: Open in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1) circuit
Air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1)
ECM

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Oxygen (A/F) Sensor Pumping Current Circuit Low (Bank 1 Sensor 1)

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Any of the following conditions are met (2 trip detection logic):

item.ptxt: The A/F sensor output drops while the engine is running.
The voltage at terminal A1A+ is 0.5 V or less.
The voltage difference between terminals A1A+ and A1A- is 0.1 V or less.
Open or short in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1) circuit
Air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1)
ECM

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Oxygen (A/F) Sensor Pumping Current Circuit High (Bank 1 Sensor 1)

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: The A1A+ voltage is higher than 4.5 V (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: Open or short in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1) circuit
Air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1)
ECM

ECM

content5.ptxt: These DTCs are stored when there is an open or short in the air fuel ratio sensor circuit, or if air fuel ratio sensor output drops. To detect these problems, the voltage of the air fuel ratio sensor is monitored when turning the ignition switch to ON, and the admittance (admittance is an electrical term that indicates the ease of flow of current) is checked while driving. If the voltage of the air fuel ratio sensor is between 0.5 V and 4.5 V, it is considered normal. If the voltage is out of the specified range, or the admittance is less than the standard value, the ECM will determine that there is a malfunction in the air fuel ratio sensor. If the same malfunction is detected in next driving cycle, the MIL will be illuminated and a DTC will be stored.

item.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs (even if no DTCs are stored, perform the clear DTC procedure).
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and wait 5 minutes.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.
If a pending DTC is output, the system is malfunctioning.
If a pending DTC is not output, perform the following procedure.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.
Check the DTC judgment result.
DTC judgment completed
System normal
DTC judgment completed
System abnormal
DTC judgment not completed
Perform driving pattern after confirming DTC enabling conditions
Unable to perform DTC judgment
Number of DTCs which do not fulfill DTC preconditions has reached ECU memory limit
If the judgment result shows NORMAL, the system is normal.
If the judgment result shows ABNORMAL, the system has a malfunction.
If the judgment result shows INCOMPLETE or N/A, idle the engine for 5 minutes and check the DTC judgment result again.
A low Air Fuel ratio (A/F) sensor voltage could be caused by a rich air-fuel mixture. Check for conditions that would cause the engine to run rich.
A high A/F sensor voltage could be caused by a lean air-fuel mixture. Check for conditions that would cause the engine to run lean.
Bank 1 refers to the bank that includes the No. 1 cylinder*.
*: The No. 1 cylinder is the cylinder which is farthest from the transmission.
Bank 2 refers to the bank that does not include the No. 1 cylinder.
Sensor 1 refers to the sensor closest to the engine assembly.
Sensor 2 refers to the sensor farthest away from the engine assembly.

Read freeze frame data using the GTS. Freeze frame data records the engine condition when malfunctions are detected. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, if the air-fuel ratio was lean or rich, andother data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (AIR FUEL RATIO SENSOR - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1) connector.
Disconnect the air fuel ratio sensor (bank 2 sensor 1) connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Replace the air fuel ratio sensor.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the engine switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Drive the vehicle in accordance with the driving pattern described in the Confirmation DrivingPattern.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.
